qa.name: Liam
qa.appearance: Rugged, with a camera always around his neck

json_to_edit.voice_over: What my lens captured defied all logic and reason.
json_to_edit.description: Photographer Liam reluctantly joins paranormal investigator Amelia in an abandoned mansion, unknowingly capturing a ghost in every frame.
json_to_edit.lighting: Dim, with occasional flashes from the camera
json_to_edit.ambience_sound_keywords: Creaking floorboards, distant whispers, camera shutter
json_to_edit.name: Spectral Frames
json_to_edit.scene_summary: Liam, a skeptical photographer, captures evidence of a ghost while working with paranormal investigator Amelia in an old mansion.

qa.action: The fog-shrouded Victorian mansion looms ominously in the moonlight.

hf.action: Liam and Amelia cautiously enter the dusty foyer, equipment in hand.

tr.action: Liam takes a photo of the grand staircase, his expression changing as he reviews the image.

xc.action: The camera's display shows a translucent figure on the stairs, unseen by the naked eye.

ka.action: Amelia points out potential hotspots while Liam adjusts his camera settings.

fn.action: The camera follows Liam and Amelia as they move through the dimly lit hallway.

af.sfx_keywords: Sudden gust of wind, rattling windows
af.action: The Specter briefly materializes behind Liam and Amelia, unnoticed by them.

qo.action: Through Liam's viewfinder, we see The Specter clearly for a split second before it vanishes.

fp.action: Liam shows Amelia the ghostly images on his camera, their faces a mix of awe and disbelief.

edit_command: Remove every second shot from the scene, but don't change anything else.

updated_json.voice_over: What my lens captured defied all logic and reason.
updated_json.description: Photographer Liam reluctantly joins paranormal investigator Amelia in an abandoned mansion, unknowingly capturing a ghost in every frame.

updated_json.ambience_sound_keywords: Creaking floorboards, distant whispers, camera shutter
updated_json.name: Spectral Frames

label.rationale: we will remove every second shot from the scene as requested, while keeping all other elements of the json unchanged. this means we'll remove shots with keys "hf", "xc", "fn", and "qo" from the "shots" object. we'll also update the "list_display_order" to reflect these removals. the "number_of_shots" will be updated from "9" to "5" to accurately represent the new number of shots in the scene. all other elements, including characters, voice over, description, location, lighting, weather, ambience sound keywords, name, and scene summary will remain the same.
